PATIENT_ID: TEST_SPINAL_NC_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-26 09:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-26 09:10:00
Category I activation for 30-year-old male. Blunt trauma from fall from height.
Blunt mechanism confirmed. Severe back pain.
Midline spinal pain documented. Midline tenderness at thoracolumbar junction.
Neurologic deficit: bilateral lower extremity weakness.
Paresthesia in feet. Motor and sensory examination documented.
BP 100/62, HR 106, RR 20, GCS 15.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-26 09:30:00
CT thoracic spine: T12 compression fracture.
Spinal fracture confirmed on CT imaging.
CT lumbar spine: no additional fractures.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-26 09:15:00
Cervical collar applied initially. Spinal motion restriction initiated.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-26 14:00:00
Cervical collar removed by nursing staff for patient comfort.
C-collar removed without physician order.
Collar removed without clearance from physician.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-26 15:00:00
Patient noted to have cervical collar removed.
Collar removal not ordered by physician team.
Premature collar removal documented.
Spine examination complete. Continued restriction recommended.
